intro: Ageratina dictyoneura, commonly known as the velvetleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, dark green leaves and small, fluffy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic properties. Ageratina dictyoneura is often found in moist, shady areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flower structure.
